understanding.C: You want a concise, actionable plan for Phase 2 of the vpm-mini project (branch main). Without repo-specific stack details, this plan focuses on feature scope, implementation steps, and delivery flow that are stack-agnostic. Paths and filenames are placeholders and should be adapted to the project’s language and structure.

acceptance: CLI provides: vpm install <name>[@version], vpm remove <name>, vpm list, and vpm install (no args) reading manifest.
Local registry JSON supported; packages can be installed from the registry into a managed store and linked into the project.
Lockfile (vpm-lock.json) is generated/updated deterministically and used on subsequent installs.
Integrity checks (sha256) are performed on downloaded artifacts; mismatches fail the install with clear error; partial installs are rolled back.
Flat dependency resolution works for exact versions (no ranges/conflict resolution in Phase 2).
Caching avoids re-downloading artifacts; re-install uses cache when integrity matches.
Unit and integration tests cover core flows; CI passes on supported platforms.
Docs updated: usage, registry format, lockfile schema, and Phase 2 specification.
Example project can be installed end-to-end from the example registry with list/remove working as documented.
